FuncDef:
The lsa-forwarding-address command enables the OSPFv3 forwarding address (FA) function.
The undo lsa-forwarding-address command disables the OSPFv3 FA function.
By default, the OSPFv3 FA function is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the OSPFv3 FA function is compatible with OSPF NSSA RFC.
-

Allows the Type 7 LSAs with the progapagte (P) bit set and without the FA to be translated to Type 5 LSAs.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When external routes are imported into an OSPFv3 area, run the lsa-forwarding-address command to enable the device to calculate an optimal route through the FA. If the lsa-forwarding-address standard command is run, only the Type 7 LSAs with the P bit set to 1 and a non-zero FA can be translated into Type 5 LSAs. If the lsa-forwarding-address zero-translate command is run, the Type 7 LSAs with the P bit set to 1 and without the FA can be translated into Type 5 LSAs.
